blocks.text: The following figures give the bending moment at various points along a beam supported at both ends and loaded uniformly. Draw the bending moment curve, and by graphic determination obtain the shear and load curves.

Distance from one end (ft) (tons ft)  
Bending moment (tons ft)  
Bending moment from left-hand end (tons ft)

blocks.latex: EMF = \frac{d\Phi}{dt}  \text{ (where EMF is electromotive force and } \Phi \text{ is magnetic flux)}
blocks.description: An electric motor function relation showing how an electromotive force is generated by a change in magnetic flux.

blocks.text: 17. By taking values of d in the neighborhood of 1.5 find the actual rate of change of \Phi with regard to d being expressed in radians. Establish the circumferential velocity.

18. An E.M.F. value is given by the equation  
\(E = 2 \sin 941\) . 
Derive the expression for instantaneous current which the E.M.F. will create in a circuit. Also determine the time when the value is zero.

18. In a circular motion, if an object of mass into velocity, v, then the rotational speed, r, is given as  
\(r = \frac{v}{R}\) , where R is the radius. Plot these figures and then obtain a formula to compare the two values.

blocks.caption: Values obtained for a refrigerant mixture.
